isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION - DIAGNOSTIC TELLTALES

svcproc.title: DIAGNOSTIC TELLTALES
svcproc.para: Several diagnostic features are included in the electronic control system to assist in troubleshooting malfunctions and/or to monitor specific operating parameters. These features include a "DO NOT SHIFT" LIGHT on the instrument panel and the Data Link Connector for using a Diagnostic Data Reader, such as the Pro-Link 9000. When a malfunction is detected in the control system, a series of "diagnostic codes" are used to identify and clarify the nature of the malfunction.

"DO NOT SHIFT" LIGHT - The red DO NOT SHIFT light is located in the instrument cluster. A system check is performed when turning the ignition key to the ON position to start the vehicle. The DO NOT SHIFT light is activated until the vehicle is started, then it will deactivate, unless a system fault is detected by the ECU.

If a system fault that inhibits the transmission operation is detected by the ECU, the DO NOT SHIFT light will illuminate, accompanied by eight seconds of short beeps from the shift selector, indicating that transmission shifts are being restricted. The SELECT digit on the shift display will be blank. Vehicle operation may continue in order to reach service assistance. The ECU may not respond to shift selector requests, since operating limitations are being placed on the transmission; i.e., upshifts and downshifts may be restricted. Directional changes (forward to reverse for example) will not occur.

para.emph: If the shift lever is moved while DO NOT SHIFT is indicated, a continuous alarm will be sounded. The alarm will turn OFF when the lever is moved back into the position where the DO NOT SHIFT was first indicated.

svcproc.para: Any time the DO NOT SHIFT light has been illuminated, the ECU will register a diagnostic code. It may be identified on the shifter display (discussed in TROUBLESHOOTING) and/or using the Pro-Link service tool.
Minor conditions can occur that will cause a diagnostic code to be registered in the ECU, but will not illuminate the DO NOT SHIFT light or restrict transmission operation.

DATA LINK CONNECTOR/DIAGNOSTIC DATA READER (DDR) - The data link connector is used to connect the Pro-Link 9000 Diagnostic Data Reader (DDR) to the transmission electronic control system. The DDR, diagnostic codes and other related information will be discussed in TROUBLESHOOTING in this service manual section.
